ygData.subject: Re: Ghoulsbanes and Chant of Battle
ygData.msgSnippet: I ve been wondering if there was anything of interest in the underwater passageway.  I stumbled across it the other night and decided to check it out.  OH BOY,
ygData.messageBody:
I've been wondering if there was anything of interest in the underwater
passageway. I stumbled across it the other night and decided to check it
out. OH BOY, I thought...adventure! Hmmm. I played it safe and swam along
the left wall the entire time...it's pretty dark down there. I didn't find
the tower or any aqua-goblins, but from reading your post I guess that is
probably a good thing. Has anybody killed the underwater goblins? Seems
like they might have some pretty cool loot being in such a hard to reach
place.

Ruldaas Riverdance
The Rathe


>From: "Rebecca Small" <macha_nabaob@...>
>Reply-To: eqbards@onelist.com
>To: eqbards@onelist.com
>Subject: [eqbards] Ghoulsbanes and Chant of Battle
>Date: Mon, 23 Aug 1999 16:01:04 GMT
>
>From: "Rebecca Small" <macha_nabaob@...>
>
>Hail Fellow Bards,
>Speaking of Ghoulsbanes swords, my paladin husband has always maintained
>that the sword casts it's spell more often based on the wielder's dex.
>After
>camping and finally getting these for 2 of the guild paladins (*sigh*, one
>more to go), we went to lower guk for a break. It occurred to me to switch
>from Anthem to Chant for the dex boost to see if that would get more casts
>on the undead frogs. One paladin was pretty sure it did help. Since then,
>they have debated whether to get dex boost items. The other paladin got
>some
>dex boosts later on and now thinks it makes no difference. The point of
>this
>ramble: when fighting undead with paladins using Ghoulsbanes, try Chant and
>see if they think it helps the sword's casts.
>I finally hit hell 1, L30 after many misadventures. Ever wonder what is in
>the caves under the aviak guard island in Lake Rathe? I can confirm that
>cave connects to the cave under the island straight out from the docks at
>the Rathe Mountain zone pass. I can also tell you that L40ish spellcasting
>deepwater goblins live in the tower in the cave underwater. Great place to
>die. Fortunately, we did this exploration prior to me leveling. Not much
>chance of a rez there, lol.
>
>Safe Journeys,
>Lady Brilinnia Ban'Sidhe
>Knight Marshall, Order of the Rose
>Excalibur, Xegony
>
>
>--------------------------- ONElist Sponsor ----------------------------
>
>131
>
